title: Fakhrul seeks elections after minimum reforms, not now
shortDesc: The secretary general of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir, clarified that they are not demanding elections immediately, but after implementing what he termed
description: Mirza Fakhrul noted that the national elections were a key topic of discussion at the meeting. “There was a long discussion regarding the chief advisers statement about holding the election either at the end of the current year, or at the middle of 2026. We believe there is no point in such a delay. Mirza Fakhrul noted that the national elections were a key topic of discussion at the meeting. “There was a long discussion regarding the chief advisers statement about holding the election either at the end of the current year, or at the middle of 2026. We believe there is no point in such a delay.
